comments.text: VerifiedEpisode 10 of MICROWAVE MAGICâœ¨a series where I make your favourite desserts at home only in a microwave ğŸ™ŒğŸ»These 90-second Eggless whole wheat Red Velvet Cupcakes are irresistibly soft, rich, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious! â¤ï¸ Made without maida and topped with a luscious, creamy frosting, theyâ€™re the ultimate quick fix for your sweet cravingsIngredients:1/4 cup milk1 tsp vinegar 2-3 drops red food colour2 tbsp (28g) butter, melted 1/4 cup sugar1 tbsp yogurt 6 tbsp whole wheat flour1 + 1/2 tsp cocoa powder 1/4 tsp baking soda For the Cream cheese frosting1/4 cup (55g) butter 1/2 cup cream cheese 3/4 cup icing sugarMethod:1. Add vinegar to the milk and mix till it curdles.2. Add melted butter, sugar, yogurt and red food colour to the milk mixture and whisk again till everything is nicely combined.3. Add wholewheat flour, cocoa powder and baking soda and whisk to form a smooth, lump-free batter.4. Place the paper liners inside a silicon cupcake mould for support. Fill half of the cupcake paper liners with batter. This recipe makes 5 cupcakes5. Place them all on a plate and microwave for 1 minutes 30 seconds. 6. Let the cupcakes cool down completely before frosting.7. For the frosting, beat the butter and cream cheese for 30-40 seconds till smooth. Gradually sift in the icing sugar and mix to form a stable frosting.8. Transfer the frosting into a piping bag fitted with a closed star nozzle and pipe the cupcakes with it.9. Sprinkle some crumbled red velvet cake crumbs for the garnish.bake with Shivesh, Shivesh bhatia, red velvet cupcake, microwave, microwave cupcake, red velvet, recipes, eggless baking, eggless desserts, yummy, March, baking, Thursday, red velvet lovers, quick microwave recipes, quick dessert recipes, no maida cupcakes2d

VerifiedEpisode 9 of MICROWAVE MAGICâœ¨a series where I make your favourite desserts at home only in a microwave ğŸ™ŒğŸ»This 4-ingredient Caramel Popcorn with the EASIEST microwave caramel sauce is the ultimate midweek binge snackâ€”crunchy, buttery, and ready in just 5 minutes! ğŸ¿âœ¨ Itâ€™s dangerously addictive and perfect for movie nights. ğŸ¬Ingredients:1 packet popcornÂ½ cup brown sugar2 tbsp butterÂ¼ cup fresh creamInstructions:1. Make the popcorn in the microwave as per the packet instructions.2. For the caramel, add brown sugar, butter and cream in a bowl and combine once with a spatula so that everything comes together.3. Heat in a microwave at regular heating mode for 3 mins. Make sure to stop after every minute and stir the caramel. This prevents the caramel from burning.4. It should be thick and coat the back of a spoon.5. Pour the caramel over the cooked popcorn and toss it well till the caramel is evenly coated among the popcorn.6. Lay them in a single layer over a baking tray and let them dry till it becomes crunchy.bake with shivesh, shivesh bhatia, microwave popcorn, caramel popcorn, popcorn recipes, microwave recipes, 5 minute recipes, yummy, march, movie snacks, snack recipes, caramel lovers, popcorn lovers, midweek snack, binge watch recipes, movie night recipes3d

VerifiedEpisode 8 of MICROWAVE MAGICâœ¨a series where I make your favourite desserts at home only in a microwave ğŸ™ŒğŸ»This eggless, no maida Ragi Chocolate Cake is proof that quick desserts can be just as indulgent! ğŸ« Made in just 7 minutes, this rich, fudgy cake is made without refined flour and without refined sugar âœ¨Ingredients 1 cup yogurtÂ½ tsp baking sodaÂ½ cup butter, melted (113g)Â¾ cup jaggery powder1 tbsp coffee powder Â¼ cup warm milkÂ½ cup ragi flourÂ½ cup whole wheat flourÂ¼ cup cocoa powder1 tsp baking powderFor the glaze 1+ Â½ cup dark chocolateâ…“ cup almonds, finely chopped1 tbsp oilMethod 1. Grease and line a 7inch microwave safe cake mould and keep it aside.2. Add yogurt and baking soda in a bowl and whisk till it bubbles up.3. Add jaggery powder, coffee infused milk and melted butter to the same bowl and whisk well till homogeneous.4. Lastly, add ragi flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder and give it a final whisk to form a smooth lump free batter.5. â Tranfer the batter into the lined cake mould .6. â Microwave the cake for 7 minutes or till a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean.7. â For the glaze, melt dark chocolate in the microwave. Make sure to stir the chocolate after every 30 second intervals to prevent burning.8. â Add in oil and chopped chocolate to the melted chocolate and glaze is ready.9. â Once the cake has cooled down, pour chocolate almond glaze on top and serve.bake with shivesh, shivesh bhatia, microwave cake, chocolate cake, chocolate cake, microwave recipes, 7 minute recipes, yummy, march, healthy cakes, no maida cakes, ragi chocolate cake, chocolate lovers, cake, cake recipes, microwave cake4d

VerifiedEpisode 7 of MICROWAVE MAGICâœ¨a series where I make your favourite desserts at home only in a microwave ğŸ™ŒğŸ» If you are on a time crunch and looking for a quick dessert fix then this 2-minute eggless brownie is here to save the dayğŸ¥° Made without refined flour & without refined sugar, this brownie is warm, gooey and just the perfect Sunday treat you need to try â¤ï¸Ingredients â¤ï¸Â½ cup melted butterâ¤ï¸3 tbsp jaggeryâ¤ï¸Â¾ cup milkâ¤ï¸Â½ cup whole wheat flourâ¤ï¸6 tbsp cocoa powderâ¤ï¸Â¼ cup chocolate chunksInstructions1. In a bowl, add melted butter, jaggery and milk. Mix this thoroughly.2. Into this add whole wheat flour and cocoa powder. Mix it well till everything is well combined.3. Gently fold in some chocolate chunks into the batter and reserve some for the top.4. Pour the batter in a 5-inch glass square dish lined with parchment paper and top it up with the remaining chocolate chunks.6. Microwave this for 2 minutes using the regular heating mode.7. Once baked cut the brownie in equal squares and enjoy.bake with shivesh, shivesh bhatia, brownie, microwave brownie, chocolate brownie, chocolate, chocolate lovers, yummy, march, eggless brownie, eggless recipes, sunday6d
